org.epochx.op
Interface ProgramSelector

All Known Implementing Classes:
FitnessProportionateSelector, LinearRankSelector, RandomSelector, TournamentSelector
public interface ProgramSelector

Program selectors perform the task of selecting individuals from a population to be used as input to genetic operators.

The population from which individual programs are to be selected is provided as a parameter to the separate setSelectionPool method. The reason for the separation of providing population and retrieving programs is that this allows implementations to perform a series of interconnected selections.

Method Summary
 CandidateProgram getProgram()
          Selects an individual program.
 void setSelectionPool(java.util.List<CandidateProgram> pop)
          Sets the population of programs from which individuals should be selected.
 

Method Detail

setSelectionPool

void setSelectionPool(java.util.List<CandidateProgram> pop)
Sets the population of programs from which individuals should be selected.

Parameters:
pop - the population from which programs should be selected.

getProgram

CandidateProgram getProgram()
Selects an individual program. Implementers should select the program from the most recently provided pool of programs to the setSelectionPool method. Typically programs would be selected with some fitness bias which will provide the evolutionary selection pressure.

Returns:
a program selected from the currently held pool of programs.
